page.title: 16WELLBURY HOUSE
page.content: Also there is a unit for 3 boys in Hitchin.The aims of the house are to enable boys from disturbed situations to cope more effectively,to provide the alternative if the situation is intolerable or to change the situation if it appears feasible to do so. The boys come from the South of England,are aged 11-14 years on admission and can stay until they are 18 years.They are in the care of the Local Authority and the cost is Â£450 a week.The two junior groups aim to develop purposeful relationships with the boys,and to fulfil the aims already mentioned.The group for older boys seeks to prepare them for independence by enabling them to care for themselves under supervision.In the unit in Hitchin the boys live independently,practicing the skills they have learnt before leaving.
